pullRequest.title: Add byte array literal and xml attribute access expression parsing
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose

Add byte array literal and xml attribute access expression support

Fixes #23271
Fixes #23269
Approach

N/A

Samples

N/A

Remarks

N/A

commit.message: Modify syntax tree descriptor and generate tree
Add preceding syntax kind to lexer and fix few check styles
Add test cases for valid syntax
Fix invalid token processing for byte literal in lexer

nodes.bodyText:
= is encoded like this when converting to JSON string. I think that's okay.
Or
since PADDING_CHAR is always =, we can  use getSyntaxToken(SyntaxKind.PADDING_CHAR) instead of getLiteral(SyntaxKind.PADDING_CHAR) in the lexer thus the value property will not be here.

commit.message:
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang into incremental-parser

 Conflicts:
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/BallerinaLexer.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/BallerinaParser.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/BallerinaParserErrorHandler.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/LexerTerminals.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/ParserRuleContext.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/tree/STNodeFactory.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/syntax/tree/NodeFactory.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/syntax/tree/NodeTransformer.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/syntax/tree/NodeVisitor.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/syntax/tree/SyntaxKind.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/syntax/tree/TreeModifier.java
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/test/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/parser/test/ParserTestUtils.java
	compiler/ballerina-treegen/src/main/resources/syntax_tree_descriptor.json
Regenerate tree and fix test cases
Add xml attribute access expression support

nodes.bodyText:
I think we can skip this check, since base16 and base64 keywords only occurs in expressions.
Then if one of those two, then we can commit to say its one of those two literals.
Would something like "field-access-identifier" be a better word for both context and method name? because qualified-identifier is a bit generic..
Shall we remove FIELD_OR_FUNC_NAME from parser rule context class as well?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -11161,16 +11189,26 @@ private STNode parseDoKeyword() { } /** - * Parse optional field access expression. + * Parse optional field access or xml optional attribute access expression. *

- * optional-field-access-expr := expression ?. field-name + * + * optional-field-access-expr := expression ?. field-name + *
+ * xml-optional-attribute-access-expr := expression ?. xml-attribute-name + *
+ * xml-attribute-name := xml-qualified-name | qualified-identifier | identifier + *
+ * xml-qualified-name := xml-namespace-prefix : identifier + *
+ * xml-namespace-prefix := identifier + * * - * @param lhsExpr Preceding expression of the optional field access + * @param lhsExpr Preceding expression of the optional access * @return Parsed node */ private STNode parseOptionalFieldAccessExpression(STNode lhsExpr) { STNode optionalFieldAccessToken = parseOptionalChainingToken(); - STNode fieldName = parseIdentifier(ParserRuleContext.FIELD_OR_FUNC_NAME); + STNode fieldName = parseQualifiedIdentifierOrIdentifier();

nodes.bodyText: we would never reach here right? In that case i think its ok to not to have the second 'if' condition

Shall we simplify this logic?

Parse everything.
if size >1 , then error. no need to check character-wise
if size ==1, and if thats not an TEMPLATE_STRING, again error.
if non of those above, then validate.
